questions.question: What is the maximum water consumption for a toilet manufactured after January 1, 2014?

explanation.short: WaterSense toilets are limited to 1.28 gpf maximum.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 402.4 and federal standards, water closets manufactured after 2014 shall have a maximum flush volume of 1.28 gallons per flush (WaterSense labeled).
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 402.4 and EPA WaterSense requirements.

questions.question: What is the maximum flow rate for a lavatory faucet?

explanation.short: Lavatory faucets are limited to 2.2 gpm maximum.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 402.4, lavatory faucets shall have a maximum flow rate of 2.2 gallons per minute at 60 psi.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 402.4 for faucet flow rates.

questions.question: What is the maximum flow rate for a showerhead?

explanation.short: Showerheads are limited to 2.5 gpm maximum.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 402.4, showerheads shall have a maximum flow rate of 2.5 gallons per minute at 80 psi.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 402.4 for showerhead flow rates.

questions.question: What is the maximum flow rate for a kitchen faucet?

explanation.short: Kitchen faucets are limited to 2.2 gpm maximum.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 402.4, kitchen faucets shall have a maximum flow rate of 2.2 gallons per minute at 60 psi.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 402.4 for kitchen faucet flow rates.

questions.question: What is the maximum water consumption for a urinal?

explanation.short: Urinals are limited to 0.5 gpf maximum.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 402.4, urinals shall have a maximum flush volume of 0.5 gallons per flush. Waterless urinals are also permitted.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 402.4 for urinal water consumption.

questions.question: What is the minimum number of water closets required for a public assembly with 150 occupants (equal male/female)?

explanation.short: Fixture counts are determined by IPC Table 403.1.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.1, the minimum number of plumbing fixtures is determined by Table 403.1 based on occupancy type and occupant load. Assembly occupancies have specific ratios.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 403.1 for minimum fixture requirements.

questions.question: What is the minimum clear floor space required in front of a water closet for accessibility?

explanation.short: Accessible fixture clearances are per ICC A117.1.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 404.1, accessible fixtures shall comply with ICC A117.1 Accessible and Usable Buildings and Facilities. This standard specifies required clearances.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 404 and ICC A117.1 for accessibility.

questions.question: What is the standard height for a residential water closet seat?

explanation.short: Standard residential WC seat height is 15-17 inches.
explanation.detailed: Standard residential water closet seat height is typically 15 to 17 inches from floor to top of seat. Comfort height/ADA toilets are 17-19 inches.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference fixture manufacturer specifications and accessibility standards.

questions.question: What is the minimum width for a residential shower compartment?

explanation.short: Minimum shower width is 30 inches.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 407.4, shower compartments shall have a minimum interior dimension of 30 inches in any direction.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 407.4 for shower dimensions.

questions.question: What is the minimum floor area for a shower compartment?

explanation.short: Minimum shower floor area is 900 square inches.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 407.4, shower compartments shall have a minimum finished interior floor area of 900 square inches (30" × 30" minimum).
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 407.4 for shower floor area.

questions.question: What is the maximum hot water temperature at a public lavatory?

explanation.short: Public lavatories limited to 110°F maximum.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 417.4, the hot water supplied to public lavatories shall be tempered to a maximum of 110°F to prevent scalding.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 417.4 for tempered water requirements.

questions.question: What maximum temperature is allowed for shower/bathtub water in all occupancies?

explanation.short: Shower/tub outlets limited to 120°F maximum.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 424.3, the maximum hot water temperature at shower and bathtub outlets shall be 120°F. This requires thermostatic or pressure-balanced mixing valves.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 424.3 for shower/tub temperature limits.

questions.question: What type of valve is required for shower and bathtub faucets?

explanation.short: Showers/tubs require pressure-balanced or thermostatic valves.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 424.3, shower and bathtub valves shall be pressure-balanced, thermostatic, or combination pressure-balanced/thermostatic to prevent scalding from pressure changes.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 424.3 for shower valve requirements.

questions.question: What is the minimum required depth for a bathtub?

explanation.short: No minimum bathtub depth is specified in IPC.
explanation.detailed: The IPC does not specify a minimum bathtub depth. Bathtub dimensions are determined by manufacturer standards and accessibility requirements where applicable.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 408 for bathtub requirements.

questions.question: What is the minimum clearance required in front of a lavatory?

explanation.short: Minimum 21-inch clearance in front of lavatory.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.3.1, a minimum clearance of 21 inches shall be provided in front of a lavatory to the nearest obstruction.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.3.1 for lavatory clearance.

questions.question: What is the minimum clearance required in front of a water closet?

explanation.short: Minimum 21-inch clearance in front of water closet.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.3.1, a minimum clearance of 21 inches shall be provided in front of a water closet to the nearest wall or fixture.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.3.1 for WC clearance.

questions.question: What is the minimum distance from the center of a water closet to a side wall?

explanation.short: Minimum 15 inches from WC centerline to side wall.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.3.1, the centerline of a water closet shall be a minimum of 15 inches from an adjacent wall or obstruction.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.3.1 for WC side clearance.

questions.question: What is the maximum height for a drinking fountain spout?

explanation.short: Drinking fountain height per accessibility standards.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 410.1, drinking fountains shall comply with accessibility requirements of ICC A117.1 which specifies maximum spout heights for accessible and standard fountains.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 410 and ICC A117.1 for drinking fountain heights.

questions.question: Where must an emergency eyewash/shower be located?

choices.text: Within 10 seconds travel time from hazard

explanation.short: Emergency fixtures within 10 seconds travel of hazard.
explanation.detailed: Per ANSI Z358.1 and IPC Section 411, emergency eyewash and shower equipment shall be located within 10 seconds travel time (approximately 55 feet) from hazardous areas.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 411 and ANSI Z358.1 for emergency fixture locations.

questions.question: What is the required tepid water temperature range for emergency eyewash/shower?

explanation.short: Emergency fixtures require 60°F to 100°F tepid water.
explanation.detailed: Per ANSI Z358.1, tepid water for emergency eyewash and showers shall be between 60°F and 100°F (16°C to 38°C) to prevent hypothermia during the required 15-minute flush.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference ANSI Z358.1 for emergency fixture water temperature.

questions.question: What is the minimum drain size for a floor drain?

explanation.short: Floor drains require minimum 2-inch drain.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, floor drains require a minimum 2-inch drain size.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for floor drain sizing.

questions.question: Where are floor drains required by code?

choices.text: Where fixtures discharge by indirect waste
Based on occupancy type and local requirements

explanation.short: Floor drain requirements vary by occupancy and local codes.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 412.1, floor drains are required in specific locations such as commercial kitchens, mechanical rooms, and where indirect waste is discharged. Local amendments may add requirements.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 412 and local amendments for floor drain requirements.

questions.question: What backflow prevention is required for a garbage disposal?

explanation.short: No specific backflow device required for garbage disposal.
explanation.detailed: Garbage disposals connect directly to the drainage system and do not require backflow prevention as they are not connected to potable water supply through a submerged inlet.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 413 for food waste disposer requirements.

questions.question: What backflow prevention is required for a handheld shower connected to a tub spout diverter?

choices.text: None if above flood level rim

explanation.short: Handheld showers require vacuum breaker protection.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 424.4, handheld showers shall have a vacuum breaker or other approved backflow prevention device because they can be submerged below the flood level rim.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 424.4 for handheld shower backflow.

questions.question: What is the minimum trap size for a residential kitchen sink?

explanation.short: Kitchen sinks require minimum 1-1/2 inch trap.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, residential kitchen sinks require a minimum 1-1/2 inch trap and drain size.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for kitchen sink trap size.

questions.question: What is the minimum drain size for a service/mop sink?

explanation.short: Service/mop sinks require minimum 3-inch drain.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, service sinks and mop basins require a minimum 3-inch trap and drain size due to potential for debris.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for service sink sizing.

questions.question: What is the minimum floor-to-rim height for a wall-hung urinal?

explanation.short: No minimum height for standard wall-hung urinals.
explanation.detailed: The IPC does not specify a minimum mounting height for standard urinals. Accessible urinals must have elongated rim at maximum 17 inches per ICC A117.1.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405 and ICC A117.1 for urinal heights.

questions.question: Are waterless urinals permitted by code?

explanation.short: Waterless urinals are permitted with maintenance plan.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 421.1, waterless (nonwater) urinals are permitted and shall conform to ASME A112.19.19 and be maintained per manufacturer's instructions.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 421 for waterless urinal requirements.

questions.question: What is the minimum water supply flow rate for a flushometer valve water closet?

explanation.short: Flushometer WC requires minimum 25 gpm flow rate.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 604.3, a flushometer valve for a water closet requires a minimum flow rate of 25 gpm at the required minimum pressure.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 604.3 for fixture flow rates.

questions.question: What is the minimum water supply pressure for a flushometer valve water closet?

explanation.short: Flushometer WC requires minimum 25 psi pressure.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 604.3, flushometer valves for water closets require a minimum water supply pressure of 25 psi to operate properly.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 604.3 for flushometer pressure requirements.

questions.question: How is occupant load calculated for determining minimum fixture requirements?

choices.text: Per IBC Table 1004.5 based on occupancy type

explanation.short: Occupant load from IBC Table 1004.5 based on occupancy.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.1, the number of occupants shall be computed per IBC Section 1004.5 using the floor area and occupant load factors for each occupancy type.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.1 and IBC Table 1004.5.

questions.question: In an office building with 100 occupants, how is the male/female split typically calculated?

choices.text: Based on actual employee gender ratio

explanation.short: 50/50 male/female split unless actual data is known.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.1.1, where the occupant load is not based on gender, fixtures shall be provided assuming a 50/50 distribution unless actual usage data is available.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.1.1 for gender calculation.

questions.question: Can urinals substitute for water closets in male restrooms?

choices.text: No, all must be water closets
Yes, up to 67% of required WCs
Yes, up to 50% of required WCs

explanation.short: Urinals may substitute for up to 50% of required WCs.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.2, urinals may be substituted for up to 50 percent of the required water closets in a male restroom. At least one WC must always be provided.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.2 for urinal substitution.

questions.question: A restaurant has 200 seats and 20 employees. How is the fixture count determined?

explanation.short: Customer and employee fixtures are calculated separately.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.3, fixtures for customers (assembly) and employees are calculated separately using Table 403.1. Both requirements must be met.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.3 for combined occupancy calculations.

questions.question: What percentage of public drinking fountains must be accessible?

explanation.short: 50% of drinking fountains must be accessible.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 410.1, where drinking fountains are required, 50% shall be accessible (low) and 50% shall be for standing persons (high), unless a single hi-lo unit is used.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 410.1 for drinking fountain accessibility.

questions.question: What standard must all plumbing fixtures conform to?

choices.text: Applicable ASME, ANSI, or CSA standards

explanation.short: Fixtures must conform to applicable ASME, ANSI, or CSA standards.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 401.2, plumbing fixtures shall conform to the applicable standards referenced in Table 1401.1 including ASME, ANSI, and CSA standards.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 401.2 and Table 1401.1 for fixture standards.

questions.question: What is the minimum spacing between two adjacent water closets (center to center)?

explanation.short: Minimum 30 inches center-to-center between water closets.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.3.1, water closets shall have a minimum of 15 inches from centerline to adjacent fixtures or walls, requiring 30 inches center-to-center between two WCs.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.3.1 for WC spacing.

questions.question: What waterproofing is required under a shower pan?

explanation.short: Site-built showers require waterproof liner/membrane.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 417.5.2, shower receptors built on site shall have waterproof liner extending up walls at least 3 inches above the finished threshold. One-piece manufactured units are pre-waterproofed.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 417.5.2 for shower liner requirements.

questions.question: How high must a shower liner extend above the finished dam?

explanation.short: Shower liner must extend 3 inches above threshold.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 417.5.2, the shower liner shall extend at least 3 inches above the finished threshold (dam) to prevent water from bypassing the waterproofing.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 417.5.2 for liner height.

questions.question: What type of drain is required for a sink used for food preparation?

explanation.short: Food prep sinks require indirect waste with air gap.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 802.1.1, sinks used for food preparation in commercial settings shall discharge through an indirect waste with an air gap to prevent contamination.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 802.1.1 for food preparation sink drainage.

questions.question: What is the ADA-compliant height range for a water closet seat?

explanation.short: Accessible WC seat height is 17 to 19 inches.
explanation.detailed: Per ICC A117.1 and ADA standards, accessible water closet seats shall be 17 to 19 inches from the finished floor to the top of the seat.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference ICC A117.1 for accessible fixture heights.

questions.question: What is the typical mounting height for a lavatory rim?

explanation.short: Standard lavatory height is 31 to 34 inches.
explanation.detailed: Standard lavatory mounting height places the rim at 31 to 34 inches above the floor. Accessible lavatories have a maximum height of 34 inches per ICC A117.1.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference manufacturer specifications and ICC A117.1.

questions.question: What is required for a clothes washer standpipe?

explanation.short: Standpipe: 2-inch, 18 to 42 inches above trap weir.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 802.4, clothes washer standpipes shall be minimum 2 inches in diameter and extend between 18 and 42 inches above the trap weir.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 802.4 for standpipe requirements.

questions.question: What is required for a whirlpool bathtub access panel?

explanation.short: Access panel required to reach pump and motor.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 415.1, whirlpool bathtubs shall have access to the pump and motor for repair or replacement. Access panel must allow service without removing the tub.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 415.1 for whirlpool access requirements.

questions.question: What electrical protection is required for a whirlpool bathtub?

explanation.short: Whirlpool tubs require GFCI protection.
explanation.detailed: Per NEC Article 680 and IPC Section 415.1, whirlpool bathtubs shall have the pump motor circuit protected by a ground-fault circuit interrupter (GFCI).
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 415.1 and NEC Article 680.

questions.question: An office building has 75 male and 75 female employees. Per IPC Table 403.1, how many water closets are required for females?

explanation.short: Use IPC Table 403.1 for exact fixture count.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 403.1, business occupancy fixture requirements are based on occupant ranges. For 75 females in a business occupancy, refer to the table for the exact water closet requirement.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 403.1 for business occupancy fixture counts.

questions.question: What is the maximum temperature setting on a water heater serving a residence?

choices.text: No maximum if mixing valves used

explanation.short: No maximum if point-of-use protection is provided.
explanation.detailed: Water heaters can be set higher than 120°F (recommended for legionella control) if point-of-use mixing valves limit delivery temperature to 120°F at showers/tubs per IPC Section 424.3.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 424.3 for temperature requirements.

questions.question: What is the maximum threshold height for a shower?

explanation.short: Maximum shower threshold is 9 inches.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 417.4.2, shower compartment thresholds shall not exceed 9 inches in height. Accessible showers have lower or no threshold requirements.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 417.4.2 for threshold height.

questions.question: A toilet rough-in is 12 inches from the wall. What does this measurement represent?

explanation.short: Rough-in is from bolt holes to finished wall.
explanation.detailed: Water closet rough-in dimension (typically 10, 12, or 14 inches) measures from the center of the closet flange bolt holes to the finished wall surface behind the toilet.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference fixture installation standards.

questions.question: What is a bidet?

choices.text: A personal hygiene fixture for washing

explanation.short: A bidet is a personal hygiene washing fixture.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 409, a bidet is a plumbing fixture used for personal hygiene, designed for washing the perineal area. It requires backflow protection and hot/cold water supply.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 409 for bidet requirements.

questions.question: What backflow prevention is required for a bidet?

explanation.short: Bidets require vacuum breaker or air gap protection.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 409.2, the water supply to a bidet shall be protected against backflow by an air gap or atmospheric vacuum breaker because the outlet may be submerged.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 409.2 for bidet backflow protection.

questions.question: What is the minimum trap size for a laundry tray?

explanation.short: Laundry trays require minimum 1-1/2 inch trap.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, laundry trays require a minimum 1-1/2 inch trap and drain size regardless of the tray size.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for laundry tray trap size.

questions.question: What is the minimum drain size for a bar sink?

explanation.short: Bar sinks require minimum 1-1/2 inch drain.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, bar sinks require a minimum 1-1/2 inch trap and drain size.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for bar sink drain size.

questions.question: What material must plumbing fixtures be made of?

explanation.short: Fixtures must be non-absorbent, smooth, and impervious.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 401.1, plumbing fixtures shall be made of approved materials with smooth, impervious surfaces that are free from defects and concealed fouling surfaces.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 401.1 for fixture material requirements.

questions.question: Where must fixture strainers be installed?

choices.text: All fixture outlets except water closets and urinals

explanation.short: Strainers required on all outlets except WCs and urinals.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 401.3, fixture outlets shall be equipped with strainers to prevent debris from entering drainage, except water closets and urinals which have integrated traps.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 401.3 for strainer requirements.

questions.question: What is required for a fixture overflow?

choices.text: Connection to fixture drain on inlet side of trap

explanation.short: Overflow connects to fixture drain on inlet side of trap.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 401.4, fixture overflows shall connect to the inlet side of the fixture trap, preventing sewer gases from entering through the overflow.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 401.4 for overflow connection.

questions.question: What is the minimum distance between a water closet and a bathtub (side to side)?

choices.text: No minimum if WC has 15 inches to centerline

explanation.short: No minimum gap if WC centerline spacing is met.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.3.1, as long as the water closet has 15 inches from centerline to any obstruction (including a tub), no additional spacing between fixtures is required.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.3.1 for fixture spacing.

questions.question: When is a sewage ejector pump required?

choices.text: When fixtures are above the sewer
When fixtures are below the building sewer or septic tank

explanation.short: Ejector required when fixtures are below building sewer.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 712.1, when fixtures discharge below the level of the public sewer or private sewage disposal system, a sewage ejector or pump is required to lift waste.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 712 for sewage ejector requirements.

questions.question: What is the minimum pump capacity for a sewage ejector serving one water closet?

explanation.short: Minimum 21 gpm capacity for ejector serving WC.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 712.4, a sewage ejector pump serving a water closet shall have a minimum capacity of 21 gpm to handle fixture discharge.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 712.4 for ejector capacity.

questions.question: What venting is required for a sewage ejector basin?

explanation.short: Sewage ejector requires minimum 2-inch vent.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 712.3.3, sewage ejector basins shall have a minimum 2-inch diameter vent extended to the open air to prevent pressure build-up.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 712.3.3 for ejector venting.

questions.question: What is the minimum drain size for a garbage disposal?

explanation.short: Garbage disposal requires minimum 1-1/2 inch drain.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 413.1 and Table 709.1, food waste disposers shall have a minimum 1-1/2 inch drain connection, matching the kitchen sink requirement.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 413.1 for garbage disposal drain size.

questions.question: Can a garbage disposal discharge to a septic system?

choices.text: Yes, if septic tank is sized accordingly

explanation.short: Permitted if septic tank is properly sized.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 413.4, garbage disposals may discharge to private sewage disposal systems when the septic tank is sized to accommodate the additional load, typically 50% larger than normal sizing.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 413.4 for septic disposal requirements.

questions.question: What is the minimum trap size for a bathroom lavatory?

explanation.short: Bathroom lavatories require minimum 1-1/4 inch trap.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, bathroom lavatories require a minimum 1-1/4 inch trap and drain size.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for lavatory trap size.

questions.question: What is the minimum trap size for a water closet?

explanation.short: Water closets have integral traps built in.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.5, water closets have an integral trap as part of the fixture design. No separate trap size is specified because the trap is part of the water closet body.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.5 for water closet trap.

questions.question: What is the minimum trap size for a urinal?

choices.text: Integral trap - size varies by manufacturer

explanation.short: Urinals have integral traps with size varying by design.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.5, urinals have integral traps. The outlet size is typically 2 inches per Table 709.1, but the trap is part of the fixture.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.5 and Table 709.1.

questions.question: What is the minimum trap size for a shower?

explanation.short: Showers require minimum 2-inch trap.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, shower stalls require a minimum 2-inch trap and drain size regardless of shower compartment dimensions.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for shower trap size.

questions.question: What is the minimum trap size for a bathtub?

explanation.short: Bathtubs require minimum 1-1/2 inch trap.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, bathtubs require a minimum 1-1/2 inch trap and drain size.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for bathtub trap size.

questions.question: A customer complains their shower temperature fluctuates wildly when someone flushes a toilet. What is the likely cause?

explanation.short: Pressure-balancing valve failure causes temperature swings.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 424.3, pressure-balanced or thermostatic valves are required to compensate for pressure changes. A missing or failed valve causes temperature fluctuation when other fixtures activate.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 424.3 for shower valve requirements.

questions.question: Are separate restrooms required for men and women?

explanation.short: Separate facilities required when occupant load exceeds 15.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.1.1, separate toilet facilities for each sex are required where the occupant load exceeds 15 persons in most occupancy types.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.1.1 for separate facility requirements.

questions.question: What is a single-user toilet room?

choices.text: Room with one water closet and lock
Room with multiple WCs for one person

explanation.short: Single-user toilet room has one WC with privacy lock.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.1.1, a single-user toilet room contains no more than one water closet and one lavatory with a lockable door, available for use by either sex.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.1.1 for single-user toilet room definition.

questions.question: A mercantile store has 5,000 sq ft of sales floor. Using IPC Table 1004.5 (30 sq ft per occupant), what is the occupant load?

explanation.short: 5,000 ÷ 30 = 167 occupants (round up).
explanation.detailed: Per IBC Table 1004.5, mercantile uses 30 sq ft per occupant. 5,000 ÷ 30 = 166.67, rounded up to 167 occupants for fixture calculation purposes.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IBC Table 1004.5 and divide floor area by occupant load factor.

questions.question: When are drinking fountains required?

explanation.short: Drinking fountain requirements per IPC Table 403.1.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.1 and Table 403.1, drinking fountain requirements are based on occupancy type. Some occupancies require one per 100 occupants, others have different requirements.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 403.1 for drinking fountain requirements.

questions.question: What can substitute for required drinking fountains?

choices.text: Bottled water or plumbed water cooler

explanation.short: Bottled water or water coolers can substitute for fountains.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.1, a drinking fountain may be substituted with a bottled water dispenser or a plumbed water cooler that provides an equivalent capacity and accessibility.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.1 for drinking fountain substitution.

questions.question: When are service sinks required?

explanation.short: Service sink requirements per IPC Table 403.1.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 403.1, service sinks (mop sinks) are required based on occupancy type. They are typically required where custodial activities occur.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 403.1 for service sink requirements.

questions.question: What is the minimum dimension for an accessible service sink?

explanation.short: Accessible service sinks must comply with ICC A117.1.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 404.1, accessible fixtures including service sinks shall comply with ICC A117.1 for clearances and approach requirements.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 404 and ICC A117.1.

questions.question: How are multiple showerheads in one shower counted for water consumption?

choices.text: Combined flow limited to 2.5 gpm total
No limit if controlled by one valve

explanation.short: Each showerhead counted separately at 2.5 gpm max each.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 402.4, each showerhead is limited to 2.5 gpm. Multiple heads must each comply, though some jurisdictions limit combined flow.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 402.4 for showerhead flow limits.

questions.question: What is the maximum distance from work areas to toilet facilities?

explanation.short: Toilet facilities within 500 feet or one floor of work areas.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.3, required toilet facilities shall be located within 500 feet and no more than one story from the regular work area of employees.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.3 for toilet facility location.

questions.question: Can employees be required to use public toilet facilities?

choices.text: No, always need dedicated employee facilities
Yes, if within 500 feet and accessible

explanation.short: Employees may use public facilities if accessible within 500 feet.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.3, employee toilet facilities may be located in public areas if they are accessible to employees within the required distance (500 feet, one floor).
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.3 for employee facility sharing.

questions.question: What additional fixture is required in a residential daycare serving more than 5 children?

explanation.short: Additional fixtures per Table 403.1 for daycare.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.1, when a residential building is used for daycare with more than 5 children, additional fixture requirements apply based on assembly or institutional occupancy ratios in Table 403.1.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.1 and Table 403.1 for daycare.

questions.question: What is the minimum flow rate for an emergency eyewash station?

explanation.short: Emergency eyewash flow per ANSI Z358.1 (0.4 gpm).
explanation.detailed: Per ANSI Z358.1 (referenced by IPC Section 411), emergency eyewash stations require a minimum of 0.4 gpm (1.5 lpm) flow to both eyes simultaneously for 15 minutes.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 411 and ANSI Z358.1 for eyewash requirements.

questions.question: What is the minimum flow rate for an emergency shower?

explanation.short: Emergency shower flow per ANSI Z358.1 (20 gpm).
explanation.detailed: Per ANSI Z358.1 (referenced by IPC Section 411), emergency showers require a minimum of 20 gpm (75.7 lpm) flow for 15 minutes.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 411 and ANSI Z358.1 for emergency shower requirements.

questions.question: What is the maximum height for a clothes washer standpipe?

explanation.short: Standpipe maximum height is 42 inches above trap weir.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 802.4, clothes washer standpipes shall extend between 18 and 42 inches above the trap weir to prevent backflow and siphoning.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 802.4 for standpipe height limits.

questions.question: What is required for a curbless (barrier-free) shower?

explanation.short: Barrier-free showers must comply with ICC A117.1.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 404.1, accessible shower compartments including curbless designs shall comply with ICC A117.1 for dimensions, controls, and grab bar requirements.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 404 and ICC A117.1 for accessible showers.

questions.question: What type of drain connection is required for a three-compartment commercial sink?

explanation.short: One trap serves all compartments of a multi-compartment sink.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 1002.2, sinks with multiple compartments may be served by a single trap, with all compartments connecting to a continuous waste before the trap.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 1002.2 for multi-compartment sink trapping.

questions.question: What is the minimum trap size for a clinical service sink (hopper)?

explanation.short: Clinical service sinks require minimum 3-inch trap.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, clinical service sinks (hoppers) require a minimum 3-inch trap and drain size to handle medical waste.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for clinical sink sizing.

questions.question: What is a floor-mounted water closet?

explanation.short: Floor-mounted WC bolts directly to floor flange.
explanation.detailed: A floor-mounted water closet is secured to the floor by bolting through the base to a closet flange connected to the drain. The entire fixture weight rests on the floor.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405 for water closet mounting types.

questions.question: What is a wall-hung water closet?

explanation.short: Wall-hung WC mounts to in-wall carrier system.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.4.1, wall-hung water closets are supported by a concealed carrier mounted within the wall. The bowl hangs off the wall with no floor contact.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.4.1 for wall-hung WC requirements.

questions.question: What is the minimum support load for a wall-hung water closet carrier?

explanation.short: Carrier load capacity per ASME A112.6.1M (500 lbs min).
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.4.1 and ASME A112.6.1M, wall-hung fixture carriers must support a minimum 500 lb load to ensure structural safety.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.4.1 and ASME A112.6.1M for carrier requirements.

questions.question: What is a tank-type water closet?

choices.text: WC with gravity tank on bowl

explanation.short: Tank-type includes gravity and pressure-assist tanks.
explanation.detailed: Tank-type water closets include both gravity tanks and pressure-assist tanks that mount on the bowl. They operate at lower supply pressure than flushometer valves.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 422 for water closet types.

questions.question: What minimum water supply pressure is required for a tank-type toilet?

explanation.short: Tank-type toilets require minimum 8 psi pressure.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 604.3, tank-type water closets (gravity) require only 8 psi minimum water supply pressure because the tank stores water before flushing.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 604.3 for fixture pressure requirements.

questions.question: What test is required for a site-built shower pan?

explanation.short: Site-built shower pans require flood testing.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 417.5.2, shower liners and pans must be tested by filling with water to the threshold height and allowing to stand to verify waterproof integrity.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 417.5.2 for shower pan testing.

questions.question: A church has 300 seats. Per IPC Table 403.1, what occupancy type is used for fixture calculations?

explanation.short: Churches are Assembly occupancy - concentrated use.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 403.1, churches are classified as Assembly occupancy with concentrated use (fixed seating). Fixture requirements are based on the seating capacity.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 403.1 for assembly occupancy fixture counts.

questions.question: What is the fixture count ratio for assembly occupancy per IPC Table 403.1?

choices.text: Refer to Table 403.1 for exact ratios

explanation.short: Refer to IPC Table 403.1 for exact assembly ratios.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 403.1, assembly occupancy fixture counts vary by type (theaters, stadiums, etc.). The table provides specific water closet ratios for each assembly subcategory.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 403.1 for assembly fixture ratios.

questions.question: What is the minimum drain size for a drinking fountain?

choices.text: No drain required if waste collected

explanation.short: Drinking fountains require minimum 1-1/4 inch drain.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 709.1, drinking fountains require a minimum 1-1/4 inch trap and drain size.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 709.1 for drinking fountain drain size.

questions.question: What is a deck-mounted faucet?

explanation.short: Deck-mounted faucets install through horizontal surface.
explanation.detailed: A deck-mounted faucet is installed through holes in a horizontal surface such as a sink ledge, countertop, or fixture rim, distinguishing it from wall-mounted faucets.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference plumbing fixture installation practices.

questions.question: What is required when a shower is installed over a bathtub?

explanation.short: Shower over tub requires pressure-balanced/thermostatic valve.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 424.3, when a shower is installed over a bathtub, the valve must be pressure-balanced or thermostatic to limit temperature and prevent scalding.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 424.3 for shower valve requirements.

questions.question: When can a single toilet room serve multiple tenants?

choices.text: Small tenant spaces with shared facilities per IPC

explanation.short: Small tenant spaces may share facilities per IPC Section 403.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.4, toilet facilities may be shared by more than one tenant in covered or open mall buildings or for small tenant spaces per specific conditions in the code.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.4 for shared facility allowances.

questions.question: What floor drain is required in a commercial kitchen?

explanation.short: Commercial kitchen drains: 3-inch with sediment bucket.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 412.3, floor drains in commercial kitchens shall be minimum 3 inches and equipped with removable sediment buckets or strainers to catch food debris.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 412.3 for commercial kitchen floor drains.

questions.question: What trap seal is required for a floor drain in a restroom?

explanation.short: Floor drain trap seal minimum is 2 inches.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 1002.4, floor drain traps shall have a minimum 2-inch liquid seal depth to prevent sewer gas from entering the building.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 1002.4 for trap seal depth.

questions.question: A restroom floor drain rarely receives water and the trap seal evaporates. What is the solution?

explanation.short: Install trap primer to maintain seal in rarely-used drains.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 1002.4, floor drain traps subject to evaporation shall be provided with a trap primer or other approved means of maintaining the trap seal.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 1002.4 for trap seal maintenance.

questions.question: What type of valve is prohibited for shower temperature control?

choices.text: Manual two-handle valve without pressure balancing

explanation.short: Manual valves without pressure balancing are prohibited.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 424.3, shower and bathtub valves must be pressure-balanced, thermostatic, or combination type. Standard manual two-handle valves without pressure balancing are not permitted for shower temperature control.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 424.3 for prohibited valve types.

questions.question: What fixtures are required in a single-family dwelling?

choices.text: WC, lavatory, bathtub or shower, kitchen sink

explanation.short: Dwelling requires WC, lavatory, tub/shower, kitchen sink.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 403.1, each dwelling unit shall have at minimum one water closet, one lavatory, one bathtub or shower, and one kitchen sink.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 403.1 for dwelling unit fixture requirements.

questions.question: Are automatic faucets permitted to meet fixture requirements?

choices.text: Yes, if metering or sensor operated

explanation.short: Automatic/sensor faucets are permitted.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 416.5, automatic metering faucets and sensor-operated faucets are permitted and count toward required fixture counts. They must comply with applicable standards.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 416.5 for automatic faucet requirements.

questions.question: What is the maximum cycle time for a metering faucet?

explanation.short: Metering faucets limited to 25 seconds per cycle.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 416.5, self-closing (metering) faucets shall deliver no more than 0.25 gallons of water per cycle, with a maximum cycle time of 25 seconds.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 416.5 for metering faucet limits.

questions.question: What is the minimum size for a dishwasher air gap?

explanation.short: Dishwasher air gap: 5/8" inlet, 7/8" outlet.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 807.4, dishwasher air gaps shall have a minimum 5/8-inch diameter inlet and 7/8-inch diameter outlet to provide adequate backflow protection.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 807.4 for dishwasher air gap size.

questions.question: Where must a dishwasher air gap be located?

choices.text: Above the countertop or sink rim

explanation.short: Air gap must be above countertop or sink rim.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 807.4, the dishwasher air gap shall be located above the flood level rim of the sink or countertop to provide visible indication of backflow.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 807.4 for air gap location.

questions.question: What alternative to an air gap is permitted for dishwasher drainage in some jurisdictions?

explanation.short: High loop may substitute for air gap in some jurisdictions.
explanation.detailed: Some jurisdictions allow a high loop (drain hose routed as high as possible under counter) as an alternative to an air gap. Check local amendments as this varies by jurisdiction.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference local amendments to IPC Section 807.4.

questions.question: What backflow prevention is required for a hose bibb (sillcock)?

explanation.short: Hose bibbs require vacuum breaker protection.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 608.15.4.2, hose connections (sillcocks, hose bibbs) shall be protected by a non-removable hose connection vacuum breaker or an atmospheric vacuum breaker.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 608.15.4.2 for hose bibb backflow.

questions.question: What access is required for a bathtub trap?

explanation.short: Bathtub waste and overflow must be accessible.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 408.1, bathtub waste and overflow connections shall be accessible through an access panel or removable fixture for maintenance and clearing blockages.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 408.1 for bathtub access requirements.

questions.question: What is a water closet flange?

choices.text: Fitting connecting WC to drain pipe

explanation.short: Closet flange connects water closet to drain pipe.
explanation.detailed: A water closet (closet) flange is a pipe fitting that connects the toilet outlet to the drain pipe and provides a mounting surface for bolting down the toilet.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference plumbing installation practices.

questions.question: What is the required height for a closet flange above finished floor?

choices.text: Level with or above finished floor

explanation.short: Closet flange shall be level with or above finished floor.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 405.4, the closet flange shall be set on or secured to the floor at the correct height so that it is level with or above the finished floor.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 405.4 for flange height.

questions.question: What is a dual-flush toilet?

choices.text: Toilet with selectable 1.1 gpf or 1.6 gpf flush

explanation.short: Dual-flush allows user to select flush volume.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 402.4, dual-flush toilets provide two flush options: typically 1.1 gpf for liquid waste and 1.6 gpf (or 1.28 gpf average) for solid waste, conserving water.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 402.4 for dual-flush requirements.

questions.question: What standard governs vitreous china plumbing fixtures?

explanation.short: ASME A112.19.2 covers vitreous china fixtures.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 1401.1, vitreous china plumbing fixtures (toilets, lavatories, bidets, urinals) shall conform to ASME A112.19.2/CSA B45.1.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 1401.1 for fixture standards.

questions.question: What standard governs plastic bathtub and shower units?

explanation.short: ANSI Z124.1/CSA B45.5 covers plastic fixtures.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 1401.1, plastic bathtub and shower units shall conform to ANSI Z124.1/CSA B45.5 for plastic plumbing fixtures.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 1401.1 for plastic fixture standards.

questions.question: What is the minimum slope for a shower floor to the drain?

explanation.short: Shower floor minimum slope is 1/4 inch per foot.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 417.5.2, shower floors shall slope uniformly toward the drain at a minimum of 1/4 inch per foot (2% slope) to ensure positive drainage.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 417.5.2 for shower floor slope.

questions.question: A sports arena has 10,000 fixed seats. What fixture table entry is used?

explanation.short: Sports arenas use assembly - stadiums/arenas category.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Table 403.1, sports arenas and stadiums are listed as a separate assembly subcategory with specific fixture ratios designed for large crowd events.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Table 403.1 for stadium/arena fixture requirements.

questions.question: What percentage of toilet compartments must be accessible?

explanation.short: Accessible stall count per ICC A117.1 and IBC.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 404.1, accessible toilet compartments shall be provided per ICC A117.1 and IBC Chapter 11, which specify minimum counts based on total fixtures.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 404.1 and IBC Chapter 11.

questions.question: What is an ambulatory accessible toilet compartment?

choices.text: Narrower stall with grab bars for ambulatory disabled

explanation.short: Ambulatory stall: narrower with grab bars for those who can walk.
explanation.detailed: Per ICC A117.1, ambulatory accessible compartments are smaller than wheelchair stalls (35-37" wide) with grab bars, designed for people who can walk but need grab bar support.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference ICC A117.1 for ambulatory compartment dimensions.

questions.question: What is a hi-lo drinking fountain?

choices.text: Unit with two spouts at different heights

explanation.short: Hi-lo fountain has accessible and standard height spouts.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 410.1, a hi-lo drinking fountain is a single unit with two spouts at different heights - one accessible height and one standing height - meeting both requirements.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 410.1 for drinking fountain configurations.

questions.question: A building undergoes a change of use from warehouse to office. What fixture requirement applies?

choices.text: New office occupancy requirement per Table 403.1
No change required for existing buildings

explanation.short: Change of use requires fixtures for new occupancy type.
explanation.detailed: Per IPC Section 403.1, when a building changes use, the new occupancy classification determines fixture requirements. Office occupancy has higher fixture counts than warehouse.
explanation.how_to_find: Reference IPC Section 403.1 for change of use requirements.
